Sentencas: Low degradation is a key feature for a successful commercialization of solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) systems.
Titulo: Nickel Depletion and Agglomeration in SOFC Anodes During Long-Term Operation

Sentencas: A variety of degradation mechanisms influences the overall degradation rate.
Titulo: Nickel Depletion and Agglomeration in SOFC Anodes During Long-Term Operation

Sentencas: Nickel depletion, agglomeration and coarsening in anodes during operation are considered as an important degradation mechanism.
Titulo: Nickel Depletion and Agglomeration in SOFC Anodes During Long-Term Operation

Sentencas: In this work, the microstructure of SOFC anodes of electrolyte-supported cells with operation times up to 20,000 hours (850 degrees C) were analyzed.
Titulo: Nickel Depletion and Agglomeration in SOFC Anodes During Long-Term Operation

Sentencas: The examined anodes consist of a porous cermet of nickel and gadolinium doped ceria.
Titulo: Nickel Depletion and Agglomeration in SOFC Anodes During Long-Term Operation

Sentencas: Scan-ning electron microscopy (SEM) and energy-dispersive X-ray (EDX) analysis were used to investigate the nickel distribution in the anode.
Titulo: Nickel Depletion and Agglomeration in SOFC Anodes During Long-Term Operation

Sentencas: The results show nickel depletion at the electrolyte/anode interface, which becomes more noticeable for increased operation time.
Titulo: Nickel Depletion and Agglomeration in SOFC Anodes During Long-Term Operation

Sentencas: In addition, nickel agglomeration in the contact layer and in the functional layer was found.
Titulo: Nickel Depletion and Agglomeration in SOFC Anodes During Long-Term Operation

Sentencas: A relationship between nickel agglomeration and depletion was deduced.
Titulo: Nickel Depletion and Agglomeration in SOFC Anodes During Long-Term Operation
